issues.description: The Solution Repository’s constructors for Seal, Pig, and Goat each take (String name, int age), but the template Main (and the problem statement examples) instantiate these classes with only a single String parameter (name). This constructor parameter mismatch will prevent the provided Main code from compiling and confuses students about the intended constructor signature.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the subclass constructors with the intended single-parameter signature (String name) by removing the extra age parameter, or update the Main instantiation examples to pass both name and age if age is required.

issues.description: The Solution Repository’s Animal class defines a private int age attribute and corresponding constructor parameter, but the problem statement and UML only specify a single name attribute. Introducing an extra age field deviates from the specified design.
issues.suggested_fix: Remove the age attribute (and its getter/setter and constructor parameter) from Animal, leaving only the name field as specified by the UML and problem description.
